Package com.atakmap.map.gpkg

Class TileTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.map.gpkg.GeoPackageContentsTable
      • com.atakmap.map.gpkg.TileTable
  • public class TileTable
extends GeoPackageContentsTable
    Object class representing the tables required to access tile information from a GeoPackage formatted SQLite database. For more information about the tables related to tile data in a GeoPackage database, see section 2.2 of the GeoPackage specification at http://www.opengeospatial.org/standards/geopackage.

    • Method Detail

      • getTileMatrixSetInfo

        public TileTable.TileMatrixSet getTileMatrixSetInfo()
        Read the info for this data table from the "gpkg_tile_matrix_set" table. Primarily contained within this info is a minimum bounding box for this data table that will coverage of the layers within the data table.
        Returns:
        This data tables row from the gpkg_tile_matrix_set table.

      • getZoomLevels

        public int[] getZoomLevels()
        Get a list of the zoom levels provided by this GeoPackage file these are not guaranteed to be contiguous, but they will be sorted in ascending order.
        Returns:
        Array containing a list of integer indexes representing zoom levels in the GeoPackage.

      • getInfoForZoomLevel

        public TileTable.ZoomLevelRow getInfoForZoomLevel​(int zoomLevel)
        Get the info associated with a zoom level within this data table.
        Parameters:
        zoomLevel - Zoom level to retrieve info for.
        Returns:
        ZoomLevelRow object containing the info for this zoom level, or null if that zoom level does not exist.

      • getTile

        public byte[] getTile​(int zoom,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Retrieve the binary data for a tile within this data table. This tile may be compressed as either PNG or JPEG. The GeoPackage format does not specify a means for defining what format tile data is stored in, so the binary data must be inspected for magic numbers to determine it's type. Additionally, the GeoPackage format specifies that data does not need to be stored in a consistent format across all tiles in the data set, so it cannot be assumed that all tiles share the same format or bit depth.
        Parameters:
        zoom - Zoom level of the desired tile
        x - Column number for the desired tile with in the tile matrix.
        y - Row number for the desired tile within the tile matrix
        Returns:
        Binary data representing the tile, in either PNG or JPEG format, or null if that tile does not exist in the tile data table.
